programme.title: Earth: The Nature of Our Planet
programme.desc: It's the solid crust of our planet, the perfect element in which to record the stories of deep time and of lifetimes. Change and progression is the way of earth. Air and water turn solid rock into soil. Animals walk upon that soil and are supported by it; but plants turn soil into life. We learn how they can feed themselves and the whole chain of animal life, in the realm of Land.

programme.desc: Two travelers, on the run from a band of vengeful hunters in the 1820s Northwest, dream of striking it rich -- but their tenuous plan to make their fortune on the frontier comes to rely on the secret use of a landowner's prized dairy cow.

programme.title: Hereditary
programme.desc: When the matriarch of the Graham family passes away, her daughter and grandchildren begin to unravel cryptic and increasingly terrifying secrets about their ancestry, trying to outrun the sinister fate they have inherited.

programme.title: What Breaks the Ice
programme.desc: Two teenage girls from different worlds form an unlikely friendship in the sweltering summer heat of 1998, but their fun and carefree days turn cold when they find themselves at the center of a mysterious murder.

programme.title: Sophie Jones
programme.desc: A teen pushes the boundaries of her newfound sexual awakening as she copes with the recent loss of her mother.

programme.title: S...house
programme.desc: A lonely college freshman forges a strong connection with his resident assistant during a fraternity party.

programme.title: Zola
programme.desc: Zola, a Detroit waitress, is seduced into a weekend of stripping in Florida for some quick cash -- but the trip becomes a sleepless 48-hour odyssey involving a nefarious friend, her pimp and her idiot boyfriend.

programme.title: Midsommar
programme.desc: A young American couple, their relationship foundering, travel to a fabled Swedish midsummer festival where a seemingly pastoral paradise transforms into a sinister, dread-soaked nightmare as the locals reveal their terrifying agenda.

programme.title: Bound
programme.desc: A mobster's (Joe Pantoliano) disgruntled girlfriend (Jennifer Tilly) steals $2 million from him with the help of her lesbian lover (Gina Gershon).

programme.title: Love Spreads
programme.desc: Tensions rise when members of an all-female rock band gather to record their second album.

programme.title: A Call to Spy
programme.desc: At the dawn of World War II, a desperate Winston Churchill orders his new spy agency to train women for covert operations. Together, these female agents help undermine the Nazi regime in France, leaving an unmistakable legacy in their wake.

programme.title: Last Call
programme.desc: A successful developer must decide whether to raze or resurrect his family's bar after returning to the blue-collar Philadelphia neighborhood of his youth.

programme.title: Lee Daniels' The Butler

programme.title: What's Eating Gilbert Grape
programme.desc: A self-sacrificing grocery worker is pushed to the breaking point by the constant demands of his dysfunctional family.

programme.title: Blue Caprice

programme.title: The Rover

programme.title: It Comes at Night
programme.desc: After a mysterious apocalypse leaves the world with few survivors, two families are forced to share a home in an uneasy alliance to keep the outside evil at bay -- only to learn that the true horror may come from within.

programme.title: American Insurrection
programme.desc: After a powerful militia seizes control of the United States, some friends try to escape the escalating violence and oppression. They must move undetected as their only hope is to cross a heavily guarded border as the militia starts to close in.

programme.title: No Man's Land
programme.desc: When a vigilante border patrol turns fatal, a man flees on horseback to Mexico, seeking forgiveness from the victim's father.

programme.title: The Curse of the Jade Scorpion

programme.title: An Ideal Husband
programme.desc: A devoted womanizer (Rupert Everett) is called upon to help an old friend (Jeremy Northam) whose dark secrets threaten his marriage.

programme.title: Seabiscuit
programme.desc: A jockey (Tobey Maguire), an automobile magnate (Jeff Bridges) and a trainer (Chris Cooper) lead a racehorse to glory during the Great Depression.

programme.title: Selma

programme.desc: Graham Norton presents a lively chat show featuring Eddie Redmayne, Jessie Buckley, Stephen Merchant, Motsi Mabuse, Sir Ian McKellen, and Sir Elton John and Charlie Puth.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon visits Seattle where he clashes with defiant Greek restaurant owner Peter Agastio, a chef so stubborn he hasn't changed his menu in decades.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: Judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller set the 12 new potters two challenges against the clock: to throw a cheese set and port chalices, as the battle of clay kicks off at the wheel.

programme.title: Rachel's Coastal Cooking
programme.desc: Rachel's journey sees her head into the mountainous limestone pavement of The Burren, visit a heritage farm at Lough Avalla and take a lesson in paddleboarding at Fanore Beach.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The bakers put their twist on the classic pavlova and take on a toffee technical, before creating a delicate dessert wrapped in intricately patterned sponge for a splendid showstopper.

programme.title: Britain's Best Home Cook
programme.desc: The nine home cooks whip up their ultimate meringue desserts, then rustle up some amazing vegetable dishes. The weakest cooks then face Angela's dreaded eliminator recipe.

programme.title: Jamie's Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.desc: Today, Jamie creates a new spin on Butter Chicken and Salmon dishes.

programme.title: Jamie's Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.desc: Jamie is reinventing family favourities, and today he's cooking Toad in the Hole, Ice Blocks, and steak.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred's Road Trip
programme.desc: Gordon, Gino and Fred start their road trip in Gino's homeland of Italy, where Gino needs help to pull off an event that is close to his heart.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: For their semi-final challenge, the four remaining sewers go to the movies, taking on garments and techniques from the silver screen.

programme.title: Extraordinary Places to Eat
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain takes Fred on a delicious road trip around Yorkshire. From fabulous bakes at Betty's Tea Room, to the finest Wensleydale cheese, to spicy samosas for just 60p.

programme.title: Simply Italian
programme.desc: Michela heads to Italy to cook up ravioli, pappardelle, beetroot pasta and tortelli.

programme.title: Kalahari: Land of Secret Alliances
programme.desc: Meet the unlikely collaborators working to ensure mutual survival in the Kalahari Basin. Learn of an elephant clan's symbiotic link to fruiting anaboom trees, a meerkat's alliance with a feisty drongo bird, and more flora-and-fauna odd couples.

programme.title: New Kids In The Wild
programme.desc: Explore the verdant rainforest of the Western Ghats in southern India, where an endangered baby lion-tailed macaque will need to learn the laws of the jungle to survive food shortages, a shrinking habitat, and hungry predators.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild
programme.desc: Follow conservationists in Zambia as they perform a complex mission to save and relocate two endangered black rhinos. Meanwhile, dedicated wildlife officers train with sniffer dogs and firearms to stop the poachers threatening the animals' survival.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild
programme.desc: Explore the largest, wildest protected area of Zambia, where a team of biologists and vets races against the oncoming rainy season to save and protect Africa's endangered top predators, including cheetahs, wild dogs, and lions.

programme.title: After The Wildfires
programme.desc: Charting the long-term recovery of wildlife in the aftermath of Australia's catastrophic bushfires through stories of hope, human intervention and resilience, this film provides an urgent message to safeguard our environment before it is too late.

programme.title: The Accidental Wilderness: Europe's Everglades
programme.desc: Marvel at the stunning conversion of a bleak waste-water dumping ground into a paradise for Europe's birds. Travel to western Germany for an intimate look at this reclamation success story, and see the thriving animal communities that live there.

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: From the vast, dry plains of the interior come some of Australia's most recognized imagery, such as the monolithic red rock of Uluru and the bounding red kangaroo. But how did the arid centre of the continent come to be?

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: Created by titanic forces and spanning 3,700 km along the eastern edge of Australia, the Great Dividing Range separates two very different worlds. Aerial footage and intimate studies reveal how species survive and thrive in this mountain home.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Explore what it's like to grow up in a large animal group that offers protection from predators, lots of food, and social contact. Catch up with a newborn flamingo, three tiny reindeer, a baby African elephant, and a plains zebra born at a U.K. zoo.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: A reef that is home to more than 1,500 species of fish. A colossal underwater trench that reaches to unseen depths. And WWII wrecks that keep secrets on the ocean floor. Explore the giant aquatic wonders of the tiny island nation of Palau.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Join two seriously ill orangutans in the medical clinic, where Erik's head infection is causing concern and fourteen-year-old Mia's life depends on a blood transfusion. Outside the clinic, the infants find a secret treat hidden inside a rubber tree.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: After a terrible accident at the nursery forest school, life changes drastically for nine-month-old Alejandra. And at forest school, the students enjoy a poolside classroom where Valentino proves he's much more than just a class clown.

programme.title: Kalahari: Land of Secret Alliances
programme.desc: Meet the unlikely collaborators working to ensure mutual survival in the Kalahari Basin. Learn of an elephant clan's symbiotic link to fruiting anaboom trees, a meerkat's alliance with a feisty drongo bird, and more flora-and-fauna odd couples.

programme.title: Stormborn
programme.desc: Feel the howl of March storms as winter slowly releases its iron grip on the north Atlantic. Meet a family of playful otters, a lovelorn Arctic fox, and a reindeer herd determined to reach their calving grounds despite the fearsome weather.

programme.title: Stormborn
programme.desc: Experience the north Atlantic's intense, brief summer with its animal residents. Follow Arctic fox cubs learning to hunt for survival, an otter pup going solo for the first time, a mate-seeking puffin, and tiny reindeer taking their first steps.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild

programme.title: Island Of The Monsoon
programme.desc: Monsoons sweep into Sri Lanka's mountainous heartland, beginning a journey through the island's forests. Follow along from cloud forest to rainforest, mangrove to ocean's edge. On this island the water cycle is creating special habitats for wildlife.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Animals that were once near extinction find refuge in the safety of zoos. Celebrate the birth of red pandas, twin snow leopard cubs, a southern white rhino, and a Sulawesi macaque, all species that are endangered in the wild.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: In the harsh animal kingdom, some lucky animal babies have a family ready to take care of them. Meet the protective clans of a koala joey, European elk twins, a litter of Asian short-clawed otters, and young Black howler monkeys.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Not all baby animals are cute. Often, quirky physical traits are evolutionary adaptations that have helped a species survive. Visit four funny-looking youngsters, including a Baird tapir, two baby gelada baboons, an anteater, and a Bactrian camel.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: The seas are alive with carnivores. Meet the sharks and rays who patrol the coral reefs, hunting down their prey. Learn about toxic fish who disguise themselves to ambush the unwary, and armoured predators who devour vulnerable targets.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: Arabia's coral reefs are home to some of nature's most impressive illusionists. Creatures can pulsate with colour, transform in the blink of an eye, or perform riveting displays of showmanship. Because in these dangerous waters, disguise is crucial.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: Off the coast of Oman, summer weather drives nutrients in from the ocean depths where they meet the Arabian sun, causing an explosion of life. Smaller fish spawn, filling the waters with eggs. This creates a buffet predators just can't resist.

programme.title: Turtle Beach
programme.desc: Locals call it the 'arribada', or 'arrival'. The magical days and nights when tens of thousands of sea turtles come ashore in Costa Rica, to lay millions of eggs. In Turtle Beach, new discoveries abound, as Canadian naturalist and cameraman Hugo Kitching follows a team of international scientists on a groundbreaking expedition to uncover the mysteries of this rare phenomenon.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Tag along as Dr. Amanda rescues a blind pet baboon, and watch Dr. Charlotte's tricky surgery on a pangolin whose leg must be amputated after a run-in with poachers. Later, chase a treed rhino, two young baboons gone AWOL, and a fiesty monitor lizard.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Face a tough decision when Esti's leg infection puts the brakes on this young duiker's release. Then track and collar a young lion with Dr. Amanda; check on an ailing bush baby; and greet the noisy new addition to the centre, a grumpy grey parrot.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Crush a busy day with the team as they release rehabbed pythons, teach a pangolin how to hunt, and round up a troop of vervet monkeys. Search for a missing bird of prey with Dr. Charlotte, while Dr. Amanda helps a bushpig savaged by poachers' dogs.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Tackle an emergency when Dr. Amanda removes a sable antelope's tracking collar, and see the animal-care team help a flea-riddled baby vervet monkey find a new mom. Free two orphaned serval cats and follow 20 yellow baboons into their new enclosure.

programme.title: The Accidental Wilderness: Europe's Everglades
programme.desc: Marvel at the stunning conversion of a bleak waste-water dumping ground into a paradise for Europe's birds. Travel to western Germany for an intimate look at this reclamation success story, and see the thriving animal communities that live there.

programme.desc: Follow the adventures of three elephants across three very distinct African habitats. Their travels combine to tell the story of how these emotional and intelligent creatures evolved over millions of years to survive on the continent.

programme.title: Australia's Hidden Islands

programme.title: Australia's Hidden Islands
programme.desc: Cast adrift and alone in the nutrient-rich Southern Ocean, cut off by wild seas and brutal winds, lies an enchanted island fortress where some of Australia's most iconic mainland fauna have made a last stand.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: The sprawling primate family includes animals as different as monkeys, lemurs, and humans. Follow primate babies to see how they bond with their mothers, learn to socialize, and adapt to an ever-changing environment.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Grab a front row seat at one of the world's few accessible lava lakes. Travel with a group to the geologically-active Danakil Depression in Ethiopia and visit the summit of one of the world's most active volcanoes.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Dive into Kasikizi Lagoon, where hippos go to escape the hustle and bustle of the river bends. Meet other residents of this wild sanctuary, from water scorpions to fish eagles to marabou storks hoping to steal a quick meal before the oasis dries up.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Battle the beachmaster, a giant hippo who rules a two-mile-long section of the river's biggest bend. Watch his fellow creatures evade the Nsefu pride of lions, who are looking for an easy meal, unless a Nile crocodile decides to steal their dinner.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Leave the river behind and stalk the valley's grasslands. Explore territory that's home to a troop of baboons, a family of warthogs, and a solitary female leopard named Olimba. Check in with a nesting family of storks and fend off wild dogs at night.

programme.title: The Accidental Wilderness: Europe's Everglades
programme.desc: Marvel at the stunning conversion of a bleak waste-water dumping ground into a paradise for Europe's birds. Travel to western Germany for an intimate look at this reclamation success story, and see the thriving animal communities that live there.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Nature is under pressure and South Africa is paying the price. But with new investment in ecotourism, populations of animals are rebounding and many species are being reintroduced. Witness one of the most exciting conservation success stories in Africa.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Welcome spring's arrival across Africa, and discover the life-giving gifts the season offers to the continent's plant and animal life. Get a close-up look at animal families raising their young, and celebrate their emergence into the wider world.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Journey thousands of miles and observe the extremes that summer brings to Africa, from droughts and famine in some locations to abundance and feasting in others. Discover how this season tests the limits of animals and plants across the continent.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Track autumn's arrival in Africa and the epic migrations it kicks off. Peer into nooks and crannies, where some creatures find one last romance before cooler weather descends, while others enjoy seasonal feasts ahead of the leaner winter months.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Be an eyewitness to the death and resurrection that winter brings to Africa. Observe what comes with shorter days, from drought conditions to frigid winds, and marvel at the survival skills of animals and plants as they face the season's fury.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: From a tick-infested rhino to the freshwater turtles who nip the insects off the giant beast, all life is connected. Follow the complex web of relationships between these species and more to see how each creature fits into one magical whole.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Italy's Mount Etna is one of the best places for volcano watchers. Join a team heading to Italy to capture a paroxysmal eruption which produces spectacular lava fountains that can shoot as high as a kilometre into the sky.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: A Hawaiian volcano called Kilauea is one of the most active in the world. After years of constant lava activity, see how a sudden collapse of the crater floor and a massive eruption drains it of lava, making the volcano possible to explore.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: The remote islands of Raja Ampat are home to a gentle giant of the ocean: the manta ray. Join a research expedition to learn about the biology, population size, and migration patterns of these astonishing animals who are vulnerable to extinction.

programme.title: Island Of The Monsoon
programme.desc: Yala Park is an avian Eden, home to 215 bird species. Join them as they work to raise their young and find homes before the rains arrive. Discover a myriad of winged beauties from massive sea eagles to ornate flycatchers and tiny fantails.

programme.desc: Seven strangers enter a ground breaking real life experiment to see if they can survive and rebuild after a simulated viral apocalypse wipes out most of humanity.

programme.desc: Time travel might be more possible than we ever imagined, and today, cutting-edge technology.

programme.desc: How do they harvest, roast, and turn peanuts into peanut butter? How do they test every device in our homes?

programme.desc: Find out how Copper Pipe Fittings, Cylinder Music Boxes, Pepper Mills and Hot Rod Steering Columns are made.
